thread.title: Ma Foi Pandiarajan set to extend support to O. Panneerselvam
thread.title_full: Ma Foi Pandiarajan set to extend support to O. Panneerselvam

author: Internet Desk
title: Ma Foi Pandiarajan set to extend support to O. Panneerselvam
text:
February 11, 2017 11:59 IST Updated: February 11, 2017 12:16 IST more-in The School Education Minister had earlier staunchly supported Sasikala 

As the Governor indicates he may wait for the SC verdict in the DA case, it is a battle of nerves between the rival camps of AIADMK general secretary V.K. Sasikala and interim Chief Minister O. Panneerselvam. 
Here are the latest updates on the ongoing political crisis in Tamil Nadu: 12.15 p.m. 
Immanuel Sekaran Peravai extends support to caretaker Chief Minister O. Panneerselvam. He also accused Ms. Sasikala for Dalit killings. 12.14 p.m. 
Jawahirulla, MMK president at a press meet in Thoothukudi said "BJP is manoeuvring and causing political turmoil in ADMK, but its surprising that Sasikala, gen secry of ADMK puts the blame on DMK. Governor should break silence and address media personnel about current political scenario in TN. Based on the test of majority in the floor of assembly CM should be elected. All MLAs should share their views freely over current situation without coercion." 11.50 a.m. 

School Education Minister Ma Foi Pandiarajan has extended support to O. Panneerselvam. He had been in the Sasikala camp and had criticised Mr. Panneerselvam earlier for his rebellion. Will surely listen to the collective voice of my voters & decide in a way to uphold the dignity of Amma's memory & unity of AIADMK ! â€” Pandiarajan K (@mafoikprajan) February 11, 2017 10.27 a.m. 

In a dramatic development, two MPs, Ashok Kumar from Krishnagiri and P.R. Sundaram from Namakkal, on Saturday, extended support to the caretaker Chief Minister O. Panneerselvam. 
P.R. Sundaram was one of four MLAs who managed to win the Assembly elections in 1996. Even Jayalalithaa was defeated in that elections.
